text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised IRM 4.70.7, TE/GE Examinations, Special Review (SR) and Tax Exempt Quality Measurement System (TEQMS) Procedures.
This manual section identiﬁes Special Review’s responsibilities and the TEQMS procedures, for reviewing, measuring and reporting, on the quality of TE/GE examinations (exams).
Deletes mandatory review cases from the TEQMS population. (Removed status 20 from IRM 4.70.7.1 (1)(a), updated IRM 4.70.7.2 (3) and IRM 4.70.7.5.3 (1)(c)).

)) because Special Review does not receive unagreed cases.
Updated the instructions for completing the Form 5456. (IRM 4.70.7.5.1.1)
Minor editorial changes, addition of business function acronyms, and addition of links.
This IRM supersedes IRM 4.70.7 dated August 22, 2018.
Tax Exempt and Government Entities
Adrian F. Gonzalez, Director Compliance Planning and Classiﬁcation Tax Exempt and Government Entities
Special Review (SR) and Tax Exempt Quality Measurement System (TEQMS) Procedures
Program Purpose and Authority
Special Review (SR) and Tax Exempt Quality Measurement System (TEQMS) Procedures 4.70.7
Purpose: IRM 4.70.7 identiﬁes SR’s responsibilities and TEQMS procedures, for reviewing, measuring and reporting on the quality of TE/GE exams. SR will:
Apply TEQMS to their review of closed exams (status
or
) selected for review. Offer suggestions to improve the quality in TE/GE exams. Report the organizational scores. Analyze and prepare an error trends report for each function.
The CP&C Operation was created in May

EP and EO Special Review groups, under the former Examination Planning and Review unit in the respective Exam functions were moved to CP&C. CP&C and SR responsibility to review and report case quality for all TE/GE exams was established.
This manual uses the following acronyms and references the following forms.

Special Review (SR) and Tax Exempt Quality Measurement System (TEQMS) Procedures 4.70.7
Each quality measure evaluates elements essential to an exam. Elements are:
Individually rated (
total). Written as questions for the speciﬁc measure. Coded with speciﬁc reason codes (quality priorities) for the reviewers to consider when rating an element, NO.
Have a comprehensive knowledge of accounting and auditing principles and superior skill in interpreting and applying tax laws, regulations, and

b. Know the exam IRM’s policies and procedures for the function speciﬁc cases. c. Can perform managerial case reviews. d. Have a fair and impartial attitude. e. Merit the highest respect and cooperation of other employees. f. Assume responsibility and act positively. g. Communicate ideas and opinions clearly, tactfully and objectively. h. Apply good judgment. i. Exercise individual initiative. (
) Applicants may be selected for an SR reviewer detail as follows: a. Full-time,
-year assignment (may be extended to meet workload demands). b. Full-time,
-day or longer assignment (to handle sudden increases in workload). c. Collateral Duty Reviewer assignment, not to exceed
% of the examin- er’s time during a one to three-year period. (
) SR only reviews closed examinations. They don’t review surveyed cases. (
) The Reporting Compliance Case Management System (RCCMS) samples selects TEQMS cases for each function by: MFT, activity codes, disposal codes and project codes. (
) Mandatory Review (MR) cases are not part of the TEQMS sample universe. (
) All taxpayer returns, related returns and prior/subsequent year returns count one review case. (
) SR determines the number of cases selected for review by multiplying an annual selection rate to the anticipated number of RCCMS case closures. (
) Exam cases are sampled for review selection when the exam group closes them to status
or
on RCCMS. (
) The TE/GE Closing Unit processes the selected closed cases and sends the paper ﬁle, if any to SR. RCCMS automatically transfers the electronic case to SR upon closure. (
) SR conducts exam reviews using the guidance in the https://portal.ds.irsnet. gov/sites/TEGE/Pages/lib/HQ/tege-teqms-ep-user-guide-
pdf . (

) The Data Collection Instrument (DCI) is embedded in RCCMS. Reviewers answer DCI questions on each selected case. The DCI automatically populates the taxpayer information for the key/primary case, the reviewer’s name and time applied, the evaluative elements and four non-measured questions. See the TUG ( https://portal.ds.irsnet.gov/sites/TEGE/Pages/lib/HQ/tege-teqms-ep- user-guide-
pdf ) for speciﬁc instructions for completing the DCI. (
) After completing the DCI, the reviewer transfers the electronic RCCMS case the SR manager and returns the paper ﬁle, if any, to the Closing Unit.

SR only reviews closed examinations. They don’t review surveyed cases.
SR determines the number of cases selected for review by multiplying an annual selection rate to the anticipated number of RCCMS case closures.
SR conducts exam reviews using the guidance in the https://portal.ds.irsnet. gov/sites/TEGE/Pages/lib/HQ/tege-teqms-ep-user-guide-0118.pdf .
After completing the DCI, the reviewer transfers the electronic RCCMS case to the SR manager and returns the paper ﬁle, if any, to the Closing Unit.
Special Review (SR) and Tax Exempt Quality Measurement System (TEQMS) Procedures 4.70.7
) The annual sample size is statistically valid, although it has a reasonable margin of error. (
) The SR manager reviews the reviewer’s work. (

) SR does consistency reviews to ensure that reviewers are consistent in the way they evaluate cases. a. Each reviewer reviews the same case. b. The SR group compares and discusses the reviewed case. c. The SR group discusses discrepancies in their TEQMS ratings and agrees on the ﬁnal rating. d. The SR manager or reviewer takes minutes to record the rationale used to evaluate and rate the case based on its speciﬁc set of facts and cir- cumstances. SR considers the minutes when updating the TUG ( https:// portal.ds.irsnet.gov/sites/TEGE/Pages/lib/HQ/tege-teqms-ep-user-guide-
pdf ). (
) SR runs RCCMS case selection reports and tests them to ensure the RCCMS algorithm has captured the complete and appropriate population. (
) SR tests and validates the DCI and TEQMS reports when changes are made to the RCCMS TEQMS algorithm or the DCI. (
) The SR manager reviews and approves TEQMS reports and case returns. (

) SR may reopen and return cases they review to the group if: a. There is clear evidence that an incorrect determination was reached about qualiﬁcation. SR doesn’t return an underdeveloped case unless there is clear evidence that a qualiﬁcation issue exists. b. There is a clearly deﬁned material error based on an established IRS position at the time of the exam. Note: “Clearly deﬁned” means the error is clearly apparent as opposed to being vague or uncertain. “Material” refers to the dollar amount of tax that IRS would assess if the case was returned (regardless of the number of years involved). Any proposed change should involve net additional tax of at least $
Don’t include penalties and interest when calculating the $

SR may return a case without an exact dollar amount if the anticipated deﬁciency appears to meet the dollar return criteria. c. There is evidence of taxpayer or representative fraud, malfeasance, collusion, concealment or misrepresentation that the examiner didn’t address. d. The case can’t be processed (for example, needs AIMS establishment). e. The adjustment is favorable to the taxpayer and SR staff can’t readily correct the report. f. The error will likely result in serious criticism of the IRS’s administration the tax laws. g. The error will likely establish a precedent that would seriously hamper subsequent IRS attempts to take corrective action. h. The error will likely result in inconsistent treatment of similarly situated taxpayers. Internal Revenue Manual

) The SR manager may, at his/her discretion, return related and any prior/ subsequent year returns in RCCMS associated with a returned TEQMS case considering: a. Whether the separating of related return(s) would complicate case closure. b. Whether a return in the ﬁle has a statute of limitation date which will expire within one year. c. Which year(s) were affected by the failure(s) that warrants the case return. d. Whether the failure(s) were corrected per a closing agreement. e. The area and group manager’s input. (
) The SR manager keeps a log of cases returned to the exam groups. Review for Returned (
) Reviewer: After reviewing the case per the TUG ( https://portal.ds.irsnet.gov/ sites/TEGE/Pages/lib/HQ/tege-teqms-ep-user-guide-
pdf ), determine whether the case meets the return case criteria in IRM
, Case Return Criteria. (

) If you determine the case meets the return case criteria: a. Prepare a summary and discuss it with the SR manager for concurrence. b. The SR manager will ask the Issue ID and Review manager to approve sending the case summary to the director and the area manager for agreement to reopen the exam. c. If approved, the reviewer prepares Form
(or similar form) to the examiner who worked the case. See IRM
, Completion of Form
, for instructions. d. Provide detail on the Form
to indicate the reasons the case is returned. Explain the facts, law, conclusion, and the reviewer’s position. e. Include Forms

in the case ﬁle. f. The SR manager contacts the Director or area manager of the exam group that conducted the exam to discuss the case return process. g. If the case is still on AIMS, the reviewer prepares Form
(or similar forms) to reopen the exam and updates the case status on AIMS. See IRM
, instructions for completing Form
h. SR e-mails Form
to the TE/GE AIMS coordinator for input. Note: The TE/GE AIMS coordinator can’t reopen cases per AIMS programming until after
days but not beyond six months of the status
date. i. The TE/GE AIMS coordinator processes Form

(or similar forms) updates the case to the applicable AIMS status code and gives the SR manager an IDRS AMDISA print to show the update. The SR manager adds the AMDISA to the RCCMS case ﬁle. j. The SR manager will update the case to the applicable RCCMS status code, and transfers the case in RCCMS to the group. (The case stays in the updated (reopened) status until closed from the group). k. The SR manager mails the paper case ﬁle, if any, to the manager of the group that conducted the exam.

) Examiner: When you’re ready to re-close the case: a. Prepare Form
(or similar form) detailing the resolution and correc- tion of the reviewer’s issues and/or any other response. b. Keep Form
in the case ﬁle. c. Include a copy of Form
in the paper case ﬁle and in the RCCMS Office Documents folder. d. Update the closing record in RCCMS. e. Revise other input items in the closing record as necessary. f. Prepare Form
-A (in RCCMS and paper ﬁle) indicating “Reopened Case and Response to Reviewer’s Memorandum.” g. Comment in the RCCMS closing record to send both the electronic and the paper ﬁle, if any, to SR. (

) Examiner: Prepare a revised closing letter if you contacted the taxpayer or resentative and/or if previously issued closing letter conclusions changed: a. Clearly indicate on the revised closing letter that it supersedes and replaces the prior closing letter issued on MM/DD/YYYY, due to the being reopened. b. Keep the original closing letter in the ﬁle and add the revised closing letter to RCCMS. c. If including a paper letter, don’t date stamp the revised letter. d. Do not mail the revised closing letter to the taxpayer or representative, the SR will mail it. (
) Group: Reclosing the case: a. Send an e-mail to the SR manager alerting him/her of the case re- closure. b. Manually update the case to status
in AIMS using CC AMSTU. c. Update the case to status
in RCCMS and transfer the RCCMS case ﬁle to the SR group. d. Send the electronic ﬁles and paper ﬁles, if any, to SR. Special Unit Case (

) SR receives and reviews the returned case and completes the following actions for agreed cases: a. The reviewer dates, signs and mails the revised closing letter to the taxpayer and the taxpayer’s representative (if applicable). b. SR closes the case to TE/GE Closing Unit with Form
requesting manual update to status
c. SR closes the “reopened” RCCMS ﬁle to TE/GE Closing Unit in status

with the “Update AIMS” box unchecked. d. If the examiner established additional years or related returns (for example they examined returns in addition to the reopened exam(s)), sends the “new” cases to TE/GE Closing Unit requesting status
updates with the “Update AIMS” box checked. e. SR mails the paper case ﬁle, if any, to the TE/GE Closing Unit as
